title: He and Ne rate of escape through pinhole opening

content.question: A 0.5 mol sample of He(g) and a 0.5 mol sample of Ne(g) are placed separately in two 10.0 L rigid containers at 25Â°C. Each container has a pinhole opening. Which of the gases, He(g) or Ne(g), will escape faster through the pinhole and why?

choices.label: He(g) will escape faster because the He(g) atoms are moving at a higher average speed than the Ne(g) atoms.
Ne(g) will escape faster because its initial pressure in the container is higher.
Ne(g) will escape faster because the Ne(g) atoms have a higher average kinetic energy than the He(g) atoms.
Both gases will escape at the same rate because the atoms of both gases have the same average kinetic energy.

content.answer: He(g) will escape faster because the He(g) atoms are moving at a higher average speed than the Ne(g) atoms.
